children: Algorithm to guide the diagnosis and initial management of patients with suspected heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT).

footnotes: Most patients with a negative functional assay do not have HIT, but false-negative results are possible. Consider a diagnosis of HIT in select patients with a negative functional assay but a high-probability 4T score and a strongly positive immunoassay.
